item.description:
Report X-2023070888

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-10
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was found on the floor of the unload and brought over for inspection. The box was opened by QA and bottles of bathroom cleaner were identified and subsequently placed into a hazmat bin. DescribePack: Three bottles had their caps come off and had leaked over halfway for each bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately placed inside a hazmat bin with plastic liners and placed in the QA work area to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2023071134
item.description:
Report X-2023071134

  • City: LOS ANGELES

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023071134 SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, two bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage. 2. X-2023071135 SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, two bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The shipment was wet on the underside of the exterior packaging and removed from the sort stream. Excess liquid was soaked up with neutral absorbent material. The rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container . DescribePack: There were loose caps on two of the bottles . DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up with neutral absorbent material. The rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container and removed from the discovery site.

item.title: Report X-2023071035
item.description:
Report X-2023071035

  • City: FRESNO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package made it way to facility when unloading the metal drum was opened leaking flammable liquid inside the belly of the trailer. Once it was discovered we retrieved the package using a hazmat bag and tote to take to our designated QA cage for inspection. DescribePack: The metal drum had a missing cap that enclosed the liquid inside. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed the damaged hazmat in a tote.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Carton was removed from work area 440. Package was located outside on top of stairs leaking. Carton was place in a hazardous mnaterial bag. Leakage was covered with Amphomg Universal Spill Neturalizer. DescribePack: 4Liter bottle is broken DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Carton was placed in the damage area for inpsection, then placed inside a yellow salvage drum, along with all material used.

item.title: Report X-2023061332
item.description:
Report X-2023061332

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: COSTA MESA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was offered to the spill clean up specialist at our station in Costa Mesa, CA. Package was an exempted quantity of class 3 in a small fibreboard box. Brown packing paper was used for dunnage and a plastic jug was placed in a plastic moisture barrier. Inspection showed cap on the jug had become slightly unscrewed and allowed contents to spill slightly and cause a strong odor. Pack was placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper was called for disposition of package.

item.title: Report X-2023070020
item.description:
Report X-2023070020

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: IRVINE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 06/22/2023 at approximately 1800, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 3916464 at the station location in Irvine, California, reporting a paint spill. The shipment appeared to be one plastic container packed into a fiberboard box; however, due to the spillage, it is difficult to ascertain. The spillage occurred due to human error. The UN Number and Proper Shipping Name has been assumed for the purpose of this report due to the shipment be marked and labeled as Ground Limited Quantity and not being marked. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023061319
item.description:
Report X-2023061319

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-12
  • City: SAN FRANCISCO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was discovered by a manager at our ramp in San Francisco when it was seen package had staining indicating a leak inside. Package containing UN 3528 was seen to have been strapped to a pallet which had become damaged in transit causing the package to be tilted. Package consisted of a multi layered fibreboard box. Inside this box was a fibreboard divider and an engine placed in a plastic moisture barrier. Absorbent material was not noted by the ramp employees. Due to teh size of the package, it was not able to be placed in a steel salvage container, however the package was isolated at the consignee was contacted for disposition.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking on the couriers van upon returning to the ramp. 3rd party vendor was called for the clean up. Remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for shipper disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023060840
item.description:
Report X-2023060840

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found leaking during sort operations at the LAXSRT facility. While investigating the package the spill agent discovered two plastic bottles containing UN1993. The bottles were packaged in plastic bags and had Styrofoam and paper for dunnage. There were no DG markings or paperwork required on the package. It was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held for the FAA.
